channel.title: How to make a server online?
channel.description:
I am despaired. I did A LOT of things, but my server is not online. I'll show you what I did.
Found my internal IP. [IMG]http://i62.tinypic.com/33az6hl.jpg[/img]
''portforwarded'' it [IMG]http://i60.tinypic.com/9i61id.jpg[/img]
Added it to No-ip. [IMG]http://i62.tinypic.com/20rl3yx.jpg[/img]
And to my Client.java file [IMG]http://i57.tinypic.com/jqjjvc.jpg[/img]
And compiled it. Now, where do people play? My client is TrisidiaX.
Is people supposed to download no-ip to play or whatever? and can they play on moparscape by adding the ip? where do they play?

item.title: How to make a server online?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

For people to play, they must use your "TrisidiaX client"
In the TrisidiaX client, the IP should be set to your No-Ip.
If you need me to elaborate more, PM me or reply.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a server online?

item.title: How to make a server online?
item.dc:creator: @boi_jx boi_jx
item.description:
@boi_jx wrote:

could be ur firewall blocking out the connection to ur source or it could be ur ports for ue client to ur source

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a server online?

item.title: How to make a server online?
item.dc:creator: @Damoiscool Damoiscool
item.description:
@Damoiscool wrote:

The IP address on no-ip should not be the ‘internal’ IP address as this that is only used between computers on the local network. It should be the IP address supplied by your isp which you can find here http://www.ipchicken.com/

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a server online?
